suncertify.client.gui

Class BrokerAppClientGUI

  • java.lang.Object
    • suncertify.client.gui.BrokerAppClientGUI

  • public class BrokerAppClientGUI
extends java.lang.Object
    The BrokerAppClientGUI implements the main GUI for the "Contractor Broker" application. It is made up of three major components:
    • A menubar
    • A record display
    • A button panel
    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Augustine Ogundimu

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      private class  BrokerAppClientGUI.AddAction
      The AddAction class implements the ActionListener interface.
      private class  BrokerAppClientGUI.BookAction
      The BookAction class implements the ActionListener interface.
      private class  BrokerAppClientGUI.DeleteAction
      This DeleteAction class implements the ActionListener interface.
      private class  BrokerAppClientGUI.ExitAction
      The ExitAction class implements the ActionListener interface.
      private class  BrokerAppClientGUI.GUITableSelectionListener
      The GUITableSelectionListener implements the ListSelectionListener interface and its main responsibility is the enabling and disabling of buttons and menuitems in the APP main GUI whenever a row selection or deselection is done in the APP GUI table.
      private class  BrokerAppClientGUI.MainAction
      The MainAction class is the baseclass for some of the classes that implement the callback actions in the application.
      private class  BrokerAppClientGUI.ReleaseAction
      The ReleaseAction class implements the ActionListener interface.
      private class  BrokerAppClientGUI.SearchAction
      The SearchAction class implements the ActionListener interface.
      private class  BrokerAppClientGUI.UpdateAction
      The UpdateAction class implements the ActionListener interface.

    • Constructor Detail

      • BrokerAppClientGUI

        public BrokerAppClientGUI(ClientController ctl,
                          BrokerClient owner)
                   throws BrokerServerException,
                          BrokerClientException
        This is the constructor for the application main GUI. It does the following:
        • Setting the GUI look and feel.
        • Creation of the main GUI menubar.
        • Creation and population of the APP main GUI table.
        • Creation of the main GUI button panel.
        Parameters:
        ctl - This is reference to a ClientController object that will be facilitate the forwarding of database requests by this GUI.
        owner - This is the reference to a BrokerClient object that is creating this GUI
        Throws:
        BrokerClientException - If an error is encountered during the GUI construction process.
        BrokerServerException - If an error is encountered in communication with the server during the GUI construction process.

    • Method Detail

      • addTable

        private void addTable()
               throws BrokerServerException
        This method adds the JTable component to the APP main GUI. Is is called during the main GUI construction process.
        Throws:
        BrokerServerException - If a problem is encountered when communicating with the server during the construction process.
        See Also:
        BrokerAppClientGUI(ClientController,BrokerClient)

      • setTableModel

        private void setTableModel(ContractorRecord[] records)
        This method creates the model for the main GUI table using the array of records provided.
        Parameters:
        records - An array of ContractorRecords
        See Also:
        addTable()

      • update

        public void update()
        This method by the client owner of the GUI object to update the displayed data in the APP main GUI table. Since the update is being done from a another thread, it uses the SwingUtilities.invokeLater to ensure APP table model coherence since the event delivery thread might be in the process of modifying the table model.
        See Also:
        BrokerClient.notifyUpdate(), SwingUtilities.invokeLater(java.lang.Runnable)

      • addButtonPanel

        private void addButtonPanel()
        This method constructs the application main GUI button panel. It is one of the methods called from the constructor.
        See Also:
        BrokerAppClientGUI(ClientController,BrokerClient)

      • addMenuBar

        private void addMenuBar()
        This method creates and configures the application GUI main menubar. It is called from the constructor.
        See Also:
        BrokerAppClientGUI(ClientController,BrokerClient)

      • getSelectedRowData

        private java.lang.String[] getSelectedRowData(int row)
        This method fetches currently selected row from the APP GUI table.
        Parameters:
        row - An integer value specifying the row.
        Returns:
        An array of String objects denoting the attributes of the record displayed in the row specified in the parameter.

      • setLookAndFeel

        private void setLookAndFeel(java.lang.String lookNfeel)
                     throws BrokerClientException
        This method sets the look and feel for the APP main GUI.
        Parameters:
        lookNfeel - A String object denoting the look and feel.
        Throws:
        BrokerClientException - If an error is encountered in the call to UIManager.setLookAndFeel
        See Also:
        UIManager.setLookAndFeel(String)
